summary: I was very fortunate to speak at another excellent Beyond Tellerrand last week, alongside some brilliant and wonderful people.  Once again I was inspired by the variety of topics and messages people shared on the stage.  Alongside the usual artists’ inspiring career stories and techies’ (equally inspiring) web design magic, there was a strong undercurrent of anticapitalist messaging in a way that is more important than ever, especially relevant given the conference happened in the wake of a truly disastrous election result in the US...
title: The art in everyday life

summary:
Day two of recipe week is this recipe for candied jalopenos that I like to make a batch of at the start of the summer for pizzas on my Ooni. 
 

    
        
    
    
    
        
            
                
            
        
        Candied Jalapenos

    500g Sugar250g Apple Cider Vinegar40g Salt1500g Chopped Jalapeños

    Add sugar, apple cider vinegar, and salt into saucepan and cook on medium heat until it comes to a boil.  
Once boiling, add chopped jalapeños and have the mixture come back to a boil and boil for 5 minutes...
title: Candied Jalapenos Recipe

summary: In this blog, I outline a solution that integrates Sigstore with HashiCorp Vault to create signed container images and enforce image signature verification in a Kubernetes cluster. Container image signing is an important layer of a defense-in-depth approach to protecting Kubernetes clusters (and the systems and data they can access) from malicious actors. By enforcing container signing policies in Kubernetes clusters, organizations benefit from a cryptographically verified assertion of the integrity of a container image and, optionally, that the container image meets certain conditions required for running in a given environment...
title: Signed container images in Kubernetes with Sigstore and HashiCorp Vault
